Problem:

Given the state \( z(T) \), can we determine precisely which interventions were used (whether \( g(z) \), \( h(z) \), or both), only by knowing the value of \( z(T) \)?
Explanation: Multiple combinations of interventions involving \( g(z) \) and \( h(z) \), as well as different initial conditions modified by these interventions, can lead to the same final state \( z(T) \), especially considering that matrix exponentials might not uniquely determine their own inverses without additional information.
